TopicTitle: N-1. Soviet Heavy Booster (aka 11A52) (OLDD in USSR) v.0.235 (13.05.14)

Articles.Content:
You can make the N-11 already, it's the middle three N-1 stages with NK-15s (or NK-33s) instead of NK-15Vs in the first stage, plus the top half of N1 shroud. I'll check how viable this configuration is, but Block G should take a payload on top of it just fine.

Now, N-111 is a different beast. It used 12 NK-19 engines (it'd take a new heatshield and a little node reconfiguration to allow this) with smaller nozzles, Block G with a solid shroud connecting it to the lower stage (would require a new shroud) and an R-9 upper stage, which would have to be made from scratch (it's similar to Soyuz 3rd stage, though). It's fairing resembled that of Vostok.
Wait? Where's the LOK?!? >
Well, it's not done yet. You can use BobCat's, but I'm not sure if it still works. It probably does, though. You can fly it with a dummy payload (just like the real thing), or design your own.
Are you lanning on doing a complete "Soviet Pack"?

Are you lanning on doing a complete "Soviet Pack"?

i thought about. If i'll see good community's interest to my parts, i'll do. But OLDD produce overdetailed models, and pack will be heavy enough i guess.

btw, vostok-molnya-soyuz family rockets are near completion, cosmos and dnepr -too (rockets modelling is easy enuff) only textures remained. as well as OLDD versions of voskok-soyuz-LOK-LK and chinas Shenzhou with interior and its launcher. also some probes like Sputnik, LUNA-9, Surveyor, Venera, Phobos has been modelled too. And my longbuilbing project - Skylab... and still unfinished LRV and LLRV. Sometimes i do not have enuff mana to work, but sometimes i can model 20 hours a day

Wow, awesome! A few questions, though:

1. Early Soviet enignes had no gimballing, instead they used small vernier motors for steering. Are those separated so they can work properly? Vostok 3rd stage has two (they stick out of the side of the stage), each Soyuz booster has two and the core has 4, all independently gimballed.

2. Molniya upper stage had four small ullage motors. They're mounted on the truss adapter between it and the 3rd stage. From what I've gathered, it's somewhat similar to Saturn V dual-plane separation (the truss separates first using ullage motors, then separates after engine ignition).

In this picture you can see three, they look like a can with a nozzle attached. First ullage rockets ever flown, too.

3. Are you making Ikar and Fregat, too? Ikar looks a bit like the Soyuz SM.
I am looking forward to all of them but I think I am looking forward to the Shenzhou the most, I don't think anyone one has really taken a crack at it yet. Atleast I can't find a good China mod.
